title: Amends the definitions of pet dealers
summary: Amends the definitions of pet dealers in the agriculture and markets law and the general business law.

       Introduced by M. of A. PAULIN, MARKEY, CASTRO, JAFFEE, KAVANAGH, TITONE,
         ROSENTHAL  -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. GLICK, M. MILLER, WEISEN-

       AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and the general business
         law, in relation to pet dealers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 4 of section 400 of the agriculture and markets
    2  law, as amended by chapter 687 of the laws of 2006, is amended and a new
    3  subdivision 5 is added to read as follows:
    4    4.  "Pet Dealer" means any person who [engages in the sale or offering
    5  for sale of more than nine animals per year for profit  to  the  public]
    6  (A) SELLS OR OFFERS FOR SALE NINE OR MORE DOGS OR CATS BORN OR RAISED ON
    7  PREMISES  OTHER  THAN THE PREMISES OF SAID PERSON; (B) MAINTAINS A TOTAL
    8  OF SIX SEXUALLY INTACT FEMALE DOGS OR CATS SIX MONTHS OF  AGE  OR  OLDER
    9  AND  WHO  SELLS  OR OFFERS FOR SALE ANY OF THE OFFSPRING OF SUCH DOGS OR
   10  CATS; OR (C) SELLS OR OFFERS FOR SALE TO THE PUBLIC TEN OR MORE DOGS  OR
   11  CATS IN A CALENDAR YEAR. Such definition shall include breeders who sell
   12  or  offer  to sell animals[; provided that a breeder who sells or offers
   13  to sell directly to the consumer fewer than twenty-five animals per year
   14  that are born and raised on the breeder's residential premises shall not
   15  be considered a pet dealer as a result of selling or  offering  to  sell
   16  such animals. Such definition shall further], BUT SHALL not include duly
   17  incorporated  humane societies dedicated to the care of unwanted animals
   18  which make such animals available for adoption whether or not a fee  for
   19  such adoption is charged.
   20    5.  "PREMISES"  MEANS THE HOME, HOMESTEAD, PLACE OF BUSINESS OR OPERA-
   21  TION OF ANY INDIVIDUAL OR PERSON, INCLUDING A PET DEALER,  AND  INCLUDES
   22  ALL  OF THE LAND, PROPERTY, HOUSING FACILITIES OR ANY COMBINATION THERE-
   23  OF, ON, IN OR THROUGH WHICH ANY DOG OR  CAT  IS  KEPT,  BRED,  HARBORED,

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

       A. 78                               2

    1  BOARDED,  SHELTERED,  MAINTAINED,  SOLD, GIVEN AWAY, EXCHANGED OR IN ANY
    2  WAY TRANSFERRED. IT SHALL INCLUDE THE LAND, BUILDINGS AND FACILITIES  OF
    3  PERSONS  RESIDING  THEREON. IT MAY BE PUBLIC OR PRIVATE AND INCLUDES THE
    4  LAND,  BUILDINGS  AND  FACILITIES  OF ANY PERSON WHO UTILIZES OFFSITE OR
    5  TEMPORARY HOMES TO KEEP, MAINTAIN, BREED, TRAIN, HARBOR, BOARD, SHELTER,
    6  SELL, GIVE AWAY, ADOPT, EXCHANGE, OR IN ANY WAY TRANSFER, DOGS OR CATS.
    7    S 2.  Subdivision 3 of section 752 of the  general  business  law,  as
    8  amended  by  chapter  687  of  the  laws  of 2006, is amended to read as
    9  follows:
   10    3. For purposes of [section seven hundred fifty-three of]  this  arti-
   11  cle,  a  "pet dealer" shall mean any person who[, in the ordinary course
   12  of business, engages in the sale or offering for sale of more than  nine
   13  animals  per year for profit to the public] (A) SELLS OR OFFERS FOR SALE
   14  NINE OR MORE DOGS OR CATS BORN OR RAISED  ON  PREMISES  OTHER  THAN  THE
   15  PREMISES  OF  SAID  PERSON; (B) MAINTAINS A TOTAL OF SIX SEXUALLY INTACT
   16  FEMALE DOGS OR CATS SIX MONTHS OF AGE OR OLDER AND WHO SELLS  OR  OFFERS
   17  FOR  SALE  ANY  OF  THE  OFFSPRING OF SUCH DOGS OR CATS; OR (C) SELLS OR
   18  OFFERS FOR SALE TO THE PUBLIC TEN OR MORE DOGS OR  CATS  IN  A  CALENDAR
   19  YEAR.    Such definition shall include breeders [of animals] who sell or
   20  offer for sale animals [directly to a  consumer],  but  [it]  shall  not
   21  include  duly  incorporated  humane  societies  dedicated to the care of
   22  unwanted animals which make such animals available for adoption  whether
   23  or  not  a  fee  for such adoption is charged. [For purposes of sections
   24  seven hundred fifty-three-a, seven hundred fifty-three-b, seven  hundred
   25  fifty-three-c,  seven  hundred  fifty-three-d  and  seven hundred fifty-
   26  three-e of this article, "pet dealer" shall mean any person who  engages
   27  in  the sale or offering for sale of more than nine animals per year for
   28  profit to the public. Such definition shall include  breeders  who  sell
   29  animals; provided that a breeder who sells or offers to sell directly to
   30  the  consumer  fewer than twenty-five animals per year that are born and
   31  raised on the breeders residential premises shall not  be  considered  a
   32  pet dealer as a result of selling or offering to sell such animals. Such
   33  definition  shall  not  include duly incorporated humane societies dedi-
   34  cated to the care of unwanted animals which make such animals  available
   35  for adoption whether or not a fee for such adoption is charged.]
   36    S 3. This act shall take effect April 1, 2012.
